body.name: Hybrid: Tide Series
body.description: Navy SEAL Brendon O’Neil spent the past decade executing dangerous missions across the globe. He never expected to be deployed in his own country. A biological weapon has hit much of the world - including the United States. People are turned into twisted creatures hellbent on destruction. As the country tumbles headlong into utter collapse, O’Neil leads a team of SEALs fighting to defend America against the devastation sweeping city after city.When vital intel points to the potential culprits of this manmade disaster, O’Neil and his highly skilled team are picked to deliver a crucial strike that might help turn this gruesome war around. These elite operators could be America and the world’s best hope. His team is prepared to give their lives for the ruthless mission they undertake. But sometimes, the cost of success is far greater than death. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was a great addition to The Tide series! And, it was a great character to explore a little more.I am looking forward to the next Tide book coming in February!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Prepare for Wow and Pow
reviews.reviewText: As if The Tide series didn't provide enough action and adventure, this standalone tie-in has lots of wow to go along with the pow. Of course, there is violence and adult language. After all, we're talking about military members fighting in a post-apocalyptic world.Brendon O'Neil and the rest of his sixteen-man US Navy SEAL troop meet their match in a battle they didn't see coming. While some readers of the series may know the results, they won't know the details... until they read this story.I applaud the author for his ability to blend so many different elements that kept my heart pounding.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars My bad. I would suggest starting the Tide series first.
reviews.reviewText: I didn't read all the synopsis which would have told me that this was a side story of a larger series. I enjoyed the book, even if the fighting was a bit too long for my taste ( though I understand others enjoy it). The story was really well told and I felt for the main character by the end. I just wish I had waited to read it after book 6 as now in not sure I want to go back to the begining after being hooked into the middle. I think I will give time for this story to fade from my memory a bit and come back to Tide.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Addition to the Series
reviews.reviewText: O'Neil is one of my favorite characters from the Tide Series. I was so excited to read this book and delve more into his story and character. Tide Series is one of my favorite in the genre. O'Neil's character shows the strength and determination and fight to win attitude of the Seals. His character was the main reason the Hunters were able to survive that mission and continue to battle to save the world. Great book and I definitely recommend it to anyone who read the Tide Series or loves this genre.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Wow this was a wonderful surprise. In this book we get to find out all about Brendan O’Neal, a SEAL going on missions with his brother SEALS to rid the world of the Oni Agent and Scull monsters that have destroyed most of the world. This book is a pulse pounding experience that you won’t want to put down. Incredibly exciting and for those of us who like the Military slant, the author gives us plenty of details too, a great read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Anthony J. Melchiorri drew me into the Tide series a few years back. I waited impatiently for each and every new episode. Now, this book appears in my you may like alerts in Amazon. To say I jumped on UT would be an understatement. O' Neal is one of my favorite characters. Just being able to read of his thoughts and feelings has opened up the entire series for me again. Now, I see the light! The Hunters rule!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Now I've been reminded how much I loved reading about the Hunters!
reviews.reviewText: I've missed the world of Tide and the Hunters - Dom, Meredith and even their first Hybrid Hunter, O'Neil. This journey back to before O'Neil wore the bones has re-infected my old tired mind and now I'm going to have to re-read the series again. Thanks, Tony! It's a good thing I bought the box set to get me started again. Any chance on getting a spin-off Tide series? Or continue the Hunters' story? Maybe?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Creative Story!
reviews.reviewText: Like zombie/ apocalyptic/military stories? You have to read this one! Most assuredly one of the better ones I've read. A great way to pass a few hours! Scary good fight scenarios, definitely had me jumping and cheering on the heroes in the end! Very good character development and realistic descriptive military comraderie that's full of heart. Excellent read!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 4, 2021
reviews.reviewText: An explosive installment of The Tide series that will leave the reader wanting more. A very exciting and thrilling ride.
I may have started with the latest book in the series. The only thing to do now is go back to the beginning. That ending had me in tears!!
